title: U.S. crude oil jumps as Biden comments on possible Israel retaliation on Iran
content: Supply disruption risks increase as fighting in the Middle East intensifies, according to analysts.
summary: Supply disruption risks increase as fighting in the Middle East intensifies, according to analysts.

title: Digital bank Revolut slams Meta over approach to scams, says tech giant should compensate victims
content: British fintech Revolut criticized Meta over its approach to tackling fraud and said the U.S. tech giant should directly compensate fraud victims.
summary: British fintech Revolut criticized Meta over its approach to tackling fraud and said the U.S. tech giant should directly compensate fraud victims.

title: Sterling plunges more than 1% against the dollar, euro after Bank of England governor's comments on rates
content: Sterling was down 1.27% to $1.3098 at 12:30 p.m. in London.
summary: Sterling was down 1.27% to $1.3098 at 12:30 p.m. in London.

title: European markets close 1% lower as investors focus on Middle East escalation
content: European stocks closed lower Thursday as conflict in the Middle East weighed on regional investor sentiment.
summary: European stocks closed lower Thursday as conflict in the Middle East weighed on regional investor sentiment.

title: Klarna CEO says a European tech brain drain is ‘number one risk’ for company ahead of IPO
content: Klarna boss Sebastian Siemiatkowski said unfavorable share-based compensation rules in Europe could cause employees to flock to U.S. tech companies.
summary: Klarna boss Sebastian Siemiatkowski said unfavorable share-based compensation rules in Europe could cause employees to flock to U.S. tech companies.

title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The 'sticky' outsourcing firms on the rise
content: Inside India looks at the growing trend in outsourcing research and development to India, and how India will fabricate its first microchip in two years.
summary: Inside India looks at the growing trend in outsourcing research and development to India, and how India will fabricate its first microchip in two years.

title: UK house sales rise since the Covid-19 boom as lower mortgage rates spur activity
content: Lower mortgage rates are sparking an uptick in the U.K. housing market, with home sales rising last month at the fastest pace since the post-lockdown boom, new data shows.
summary: Lower mortgage rates are sparking an uptick in the U.K. housing market, with home sales rising last month at the fastest pace since the post-lockdown boom, new data shows.

title: Young Chinese are 'retiring' in the countryside as China's unemployment woes grate
content: China's youths are retreating to the countryside after getting fired from their jobs, or unable to secure one that they are content with.
summary: China's youths are retreating to the countryside after getting fired from their jobs, or unable to secure one that they are content with.

title: A private island for $1,000 per night — for those who are willing to get there
content: Pinang Island is a rustic eco-resort that opened two years ago in Indonesia. But traveling to the remote island often requires three flights and a boat ride.
summary: Pinang Island is a rustic eco-resort that opened two years ago in Indonesia. But traveling to the remote island often requires three flights and a boat ride.

title: OpenAI gets $4 billion revolving credit line, giving it more than $10 billion in liquidity
content: On top of its latest funding round, OpenAI has put a $4 billion revolving credit line in place — bringing its total liquidity to more than $10 billion.
summary: On top of its latest funding round, OpenAI has put a $4 billion revolving credit line in place — bringing its total liquidity to more than $10 billion.

title: Auto giants are getting nervous about the prospect of mega fines as EV demand falters
content: Europe's top car giants appear to be increasingly concerned about the prospect of massive fines, particularly as electric vehicle demand falters.

title: Biden administration can move forward with student loan forgiveness, federal judge rules
content: A federal judge will let expire a temporary restraining order against the Biden administration's sweeping new student loan forgiveness plan.
summary: A federal judge will let expire a temporary restraining order against the Biden administration's sweeping new student loan forgiveness plan.

title: Hong Kong snaps six-day winning streak as China stimulus rally fizzles
content: Markets in mainland China will remain closed until Oct. 8 for a week-long holiday and South Korea will be shut Thursday for National Foundation Day.

title: Japan still expected to stick to hiking cycle despite PM Ishiba's dovish turn
content: Japanese currency experts are not budging from their Bank of Japan rate policy expectations even as the yen falls.

title: U.S. bans Chinese firms in Uyghur region as Beijing fights forced labor claims
content: The U.S. has added two new Chinese companies to Xinjiang trade blacklist one week after Beijing launched a retaliation against forced labor claims.

title: The East and Gulf coast ports strike could be a no-win situation for the Biden administration
content: President Biden is sticking to his position of not forcing striking port union workers back on the job, a political call that adds uncertainty to inflation.
summary: President Biden is sticking to his position of not forcing striking port union workers back on the job, a political call that adds uncertainty to inflation.

title: China stock ETFs rip higher even as mainland markets close for holiday
content: Exchange-traded funds overseas that track Chinese stocks continued their rally Wednesday even as mainland markets were shut for a week-long holiday.

title: I grew my side hustle into a $20,000 a month business — here are 4 tips I have for aspiring entrepreneurs
content: Jean Kang, 32, quit her decade-long career in tech to go all-in on her side hustle. Since February, her business has brought in about $160,000.
summary: Jean Kang, 32, quit her decade-long career in tech to go all-in on her side hustle. Since February, her business has brought in about $160,000.

title: Mining giant Fortescue says it's time to walk away from the 'proven fantasy' of net zero

content: Gold bars launched at Costco in August 2023, and not even two months later were selling out within hours of a restock.

title: Yale's Stephen Roach: Markets are in danger of being 'whipsawed' by Middle East conflict, U.S. unemployment

title: Michael Jordan's 23XI Racing team sues NASCAR and CEO Jim France
